title: Everglades National Park: Ten Thousand Islands
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do     Canoe and Kayak Trails     Ten Thousand Islands                Ten Thousand Islands      The Ten Thousand Islands are a labyrinth of water and mangroves.  The islands harbor an abundance of life, and the shallows serve as nursery grounds for countless marine species.  Boaters should be mindful of the depth of the water, as shallows are common.  Finding your way through this area of the park can be difficult, and it is strongly recommended that visitors reference NOAA Charts #11430 and 11432 to assist them. Those looking for some places to explore in the area may want to consider Turner River, Halfway Creek, Sandfly Island, or the East River.
